page.title: 03Frocester Hill,its setting.
page.content: Among its Flora & Fauna are:Knapweed, Marjoram,Rockrose,Twayblade,Yellow Wort,Felwort,Salad Burnet,Thyme,Basil, Stemless Thistle,Hairy Violet,Centaury Harebell,Cowslip,Scabious,Birdsfoot Trefoil,Hemp Agrimony and Primrose. Butterflies:Brimstone,Small Copper, Chalkhill Blue,Meadow Brown, Marbled White,Small Skipper,Five Spot Burnet Moth and Tortoiseshell. On the hill is evidence of Fox,Badger Rabbit and small rodents.Where the land is not grazed Bracken and Gorse invade. For years Gliders have flown above the hill but in recent times the Avon Hang Gliding Club have used The Peak. Distances from the Viewpoint:Cam Long Down 1m.Chepstow 17m.Berkeley Power St 8.5m.R.Severn 9m.Sharpness 7.5m Brecon Beacons 50m.Black Mts.40m.Malvern 24m. Forest of Dean 12m.Froc.1.75m.Glos.11m
